description: A curved steel chestplate comprised of two pressed steel plates designed to protect the torso from the front. Intended for use by Soviet Assault engineers during the Second World War with limited success. Generally considered to only be proof against pistol-caliber ammunition.

Designed to resist the hellish conditions on the western front in the First World War, the Sappenpanzer was designed for use with specialized front-line Germany Infantry. It is essentially a semi-articulated cuirass designed to protect the front half of the torso. This is the light weight version of the armor, weighing in at around 9 kilograms.
